F7fCalnWBBnOVm9T2yvrnw.text: I haven't eaten at every joint in Pittsburgh, but I'm convinced that Homewood is the center of Pittsburgh's barbeque world. There's the Dream BBQ, and the Showcase, so close to each other you could do a rib-off and the sides wouldn't have time to get cold. Both are good places to eat, but the Showcase edges into greatness with ribs I found slightly more tender, greens that are fantastically smoky and good, and a Hot as Hell sauce that lives up to its name and is actually quite addictive. Vegetarians, if you get dragged here, it's worth noting that the sides are prepared without pork (according to the menu), so you have some delicious options.    Having eaten at both, my choice of Showcase or Dream might actually depend on the mood I'm in, the kind of sauce I want - but if I had guests and wanted to feed them really, really impressive ribs, I'd head over to the Showcase.

gsE_BxPbEXCRHOE9A6VVKA.text: One of the best bbq/soul food takeout places in town! I just want to lick their homemade sauce that they put on the ribs and chicken .. its umm, umm good! Everything is delicious. They have a nice selection of meats and sides that are usually already prepared (you don't have to wait long). I've always had good service and a smile when I go to Showcase BBQ. My only suggestion would be to add some corn bread to the menu and a few more specialty side dishes and desserts.   Looks can be deceiving. This is a small take out restaurant at the border of Homewood and Lincoln-Lemington. Don't be afraid, you are safe to park your car and go inside and order food.   The owner is always grilling food outside, no matter what the weather. And we know the weather can be nasty in Pittsburgh (snow, rain) - but he is always out there.   Showcase also does catering and I've had their food at local events. I definitely recommend this place. The prices are RIGHT and you get a lot of food for the money. Most dinners are about $10.

N0tVJbN7Jcj-sbrfGN_BiQ.text: Thought I would try a new (new to me, anyway) BBQ place yesterday and settled on the Showcase. If you are fussy about appearances, you'll probably want to go elsewhere, as it is spartan on the inside. But I'm only interested in the food, so it didn't bother me to get some takeout.    We got a half-rack of pork ribs, a pulled pork sandwich, mac-and-cheese, and baked beans.  The ribs were pretty good, with a good bit of crispy bark, a little on the dry side and middle of the road for meatyness. The server put the sauce right over the ribs and dished out a hefty amount.  I loved their homemade sauce and kept slathering it back onto the ribs each time I picked one up --  I might still have a little in my ears, actually.  The mac and cheese wasn't the very creamy style some people prefer.  I really liked the taste and was glad I could eat it without worrying about drips.   She liked the pulled pork which was served with the sauce on plain white bread. The baked beans were too spicy for her and she gave them to me after three bites. She wanted to eat them but the heat level was beyond her low level of tolerance. They were very tasty but I agree they were hot.    Both of the sides were generously sized.  The inexpensive prices earned the 4th star. Would go again.

GZG5DuMnYkJEtEFoDbR1ow.text: The ribs are wonderful, meaty and tender. Twelve bones was plenty for 3 people. If you add sauce, expect to be pleasantly surprised. The baked beans were good, with a little bite. We'd go back for the ribs and chicken!

yDLAHs91nOaCanVysrTfWg.text: It's exactly what it says it is - great barbecue. You're not going to go here to find white tablecloths or the like, so you'll get just what you expect.  I had the 2 ribs, 3 wings, and 2 small sides dinner ($10) and it was plenty. The ribs were huge, there was about as much rib beyond the bone as there was on it. The thicker end with the bone was about an inch and a quarter to an inch and a half thick, and it quickly fell apart into two pieces when I picked it up. The meat had a little chew to it along the thinner edges, and the thick parts just fell apart, just the way I like ribs.  The mild sauce wasn't the usual intense red, I'm not sure what region to identify it with, but it was good. The hot was a bright red, and they warned that its very hot. I tried it too, and it's definitely on the hotter end for barbecue sauce although I didn't think it was too hot for the ribs.  I'm glad to have found this place just a couple blocks from where I'll be working for a while, I'll be going back for more.

s1mbGfTtBI2Lr1dzBdd6MA.text: This is best BBQ in the Pittsburgh area! Ribs are always  moist and tender! Sides are tasty great variety almost always available!  Except 30 min before closing ! You can smell the smoke from this place for 1/2 mile radius!  Can be busy so get there early!

Jzbj0klYwbsuq8vH3R0QMQ.text: Appearances continue to deceive, especially when it comes to low-key places like this one. Passing by this place, I almost missed it, but then our noses were alerted to the huge grills outside the side of the shop. So impressive! It was barely above freezing the day that we went, but this guy was grilling those ribs like no tomorrow. Good publicity technique, to be sure, but we took this to be a good sign right away.  The place itself is quite small; you walk in and you immediately bump into the end of the line if there is one. You order from the counter as usual, and there are a few (like 3 or 4) small tables to the side if you want to eat in. I don't know if it gets full here; we came around 1 but during our stay no one customer ate in.   For about $18, we got a 4 bone and 6 (but they actually gave like 9!) wing combo, plus two sides and two sodas. It was so cheap, and we almost had trouble finishing everything in the end. Their homemade sauce is quite interesting--not too sweet with hints of sour. Went really well with the wings. But for the bones, both the pork and turkey were so delicious that we didn't bother smothering much sauce on them. The pork ribs were large and tender; the turkey was juicy and delicious. I will be honest here--never in my life have I really enjoyed turkey before this. I've always deemed it too dry compared to other poultry, but their turkey really is unbelievable.  As for the sides, we got the candied yams and greens. Both were great choices, and they gave hearty servings of each. Really good complement to all the meat, making our overall meal a great experience. This will definitely be our future go-to place for pork ribs and turkey!

JdRMJqGM5c6aY12Pkdu_Ng.text: Hands down the best BBQ wings in Pittsburgh. Fantastic turkey ribs. If you're feeling daring try the Hot sauce. I like to mix the mild and hot together. Honestly the seasoning is so good sometimes you don't even need the sauce on. Great place.

d0QUpP4baOtYAlvTgIoCOg.text: I am a native Pittsburgher, but my soul belongs in the south with soul food and all that other good stuff!  After celebrating the end of finals, I sauntered over to East End brewing with some friends. After a few tastings, we decided we were hungry for some RIBS.   Off we ventured into the cold, the wind cuttting like shrapnel as we traverse the path from East End to showcase. Our foray towards the smoked barbeque glory would have made Edward Hillary proud. Our heads looking down to the ground, and holding on to our caps, we continued in single file and single purpose.  Showcase was a beacon of light, reminscent of the smoldering campfire in the middle of the woods to ease weary travellers. The equipment was simplistic, half drum smokers wafting a delicious and time honored recipe into our nostrils. As we huddled inside, taking in our surroundings, we saw that other travelers of all walks of life underwent the same pilgrimage to this protein laden Mecca.   Samples of ribs, greens, turkey legs, and macaroni and cheese were passed around in a communion to the gods of barbeque.   Moist and succulent morsels dimmed the conversation to non verbal affirmations and murmurs of delight between mouthfuls.  The staff was pleasant, undertaking their holy work with gusto and pride.  Showcase,   I am a believer.

Rwcxy6v4o1raSC8UMJvm8g.text: I stopped by Showcase recently to get a quick BBQ fix and they did not disappoint! The smokers were firing on all cylinders and the smell was delishly intoxicating.  I ordered a dinner for my Mom that included 6 pork bones, baked mac n cheese and greens. I ordered the wing and pork bone dinners with a side of potato salad and collard greens. The sauce was superb, sweet and complimentary to the smoke.  The meat was cooked very well and fell off the bone.  There were a few pieces that stayed on the fire too long, but still good.  The greens had just the right amount of seasons with the touch of vinegar. My potato salad was perfect and had a good balance of eggs, relish, soft potatoes and seasonings. AHfYV-ZqOfnIoVMHl8Dw6A.text: Hands down the best ribs in Pittsburgh!   This place may look like a dive, but it definitely serves up some great bbq. This place blows Big Mama's out of the water! They are take out only. They offer barbeque chicken, ribs and burgers. The ribs are so tender they melt in your mouth!  Pork Ribs: A whole slab cost $25. A 1/2 slab cost $10.50. Rib sandwich with four bones cost $6.50. A bone cost $2.00.  Beef Ribs: A whole slab cost $13.  Dinners: A full slab (12 bones) with four small or two large sides cost $26.00. A 1/2 slab (six bones) with two sides cost $13.00. A four bone dinner with two sides costs $9.50. A three bone dinner with two sides costs $9.00. Six wings with two sides costs $8.00.   Two bones, three wings and two sides cost $9.00.  Jitney Special Two bones, a hotdog and three wings cost $9.00.  Kids Special One bone, two wings and one side cost $5.50  Sides consists of yams, mac & cheese, broccoli & cheese, greens, red beans n rice, baked beans, green beans and potato salad and cost $2.25 for a small and $3.75 for a large.  Wings: 4     $3.56 6     $5.34 8     $7.12 10   $8.90 12   $10.68 15   $12.75 18   $15.30 24   $20.40 30   $24.90 40   $33.20 50   $41.50 75   $62.25 100 $83.00   They also cater private parties and sporting events. You will need to call two hours in advance for beef ribs. Visa and Mastercard are accepted.  I highly recommend this place!

HA2AjudIFTVJX2Dg-v0wug.text: I went for the first time today. Heard great reviews about their turkey and beef ribs, and wanted to give it a try. Once there, it was said turkey and/or beef ribs had to be 'pre-ordered' at least 2 hours in advance. I understood their reasoning behind it, since pork is a more popular meat. But nevertheless, I was still slightly disappointed. (Since I don't eat pork).   I ended up purchasing a 6 wing dinner with yams and macaroni & cheese as my sides. The chicken was good, but VERY small. The yams were good. However a bit too sweet for my liking. The macaroni & cheese was a bit dry with a weird after taste of stuffing...oh god! (Not sure if stuffing got in my mac and cheese or if they actually use stuffing mix as part of the recipe.) But I've never been a fan of stuffing, so I was a little thrown off by the taste.   I will say that Showcase has some of the best homemade BBQ sauce I had ever tasted! If i remember  to order my ribs in advance I will come back and try different sides.

D9eTMtF6P7IHi7zuOCqZXQ.text: A coworker recommended this place to me so I decided to try it out. More of a takeout place then a restaurant. The food  was awesome and the service was good. I would give it more stars but I had an issue with the price. The prices on the menu board did not match the total I paid.  I ordered 4 bones (comes with 2 sides) for $10/11 and a brisket sandwich for $6. Somehow the total came to $24. There was another guy ordering at the same time so maybe the prices got mixed up. I didn't realize what I paid until I was half way home (totally my fault for not paying attention).  I would go back because the bbq was tasty.

ZkZp95Z7AKGiE8Oa2sU0Gw.text: Small dine-in, takeout Resturant offering home style soul food and BBQ. The BBQ baked beans got my full attention, like the saying "it tastes so good I'll make you smack..", it was worth every cent. My next fav was the BBQ chicken. It was seasoned to perfection and was moist. The greens and ribs were ok when compared to the chicken and beans as well as to other rib places in the city. They cook the ribs with the membrane film (not my fav) and the greens was on the coarse side. I'll defiantly return to try their turkey ribs and to get more of those soulful beans.

FKMGXacgLtB6m9y545OW5w.text: This place has been around for years and not a year went by when the food wasn't good.    They have often been a staple at local events and wether on the road or at the shop, the quality is always second to none.  Local owned with that Pittsburgh Pride, this is quality food.

k64r9HD46j8QC4W6XJIPXw.text: Very good food. I got the plate with 2 ribs, 3 wings, macaroni and greens. Excellent value for $10. Large tasty meaty ribs, the wings were a little small but very tasty, greens were very good macaroni was adequate, not bad, not great, just a bit bland and the macaroni was pretty soft, but that's typical at BBQ places. The BBQ Sauce has a nice zing, it's an opaque sauce that almost looks like brown gravy, apparently a mix of red chili based and mustard sauce. If the review were just about the food, I'd give Showcase a 5, it's the best BBQ I've had in Pittsburgh to date, better than Pittsburgh BBQ, Z-Best or Rowdy.  But one star off for ambience, which it does not have (nor do the others). So you probably shouldn't take a date or your boss here. The ceiling is unpainted sheetrock, the bathroom faces the dining area and with the door open, you'll be staring at a toilet as you eat. But of course you can get your order to go, or in nice weather you can eat at the tables outside or head to Frick park.

dFlkrYxSGXaFtEMZvn3dlA.text: I live in Tampa but I am from Pittsburgh. I've probably tasted almost every BBQ place in tampa in my give years of living there and very few are better than the meal I had from showcase Bbq. At first I was skeptical because of some of the internet reviews but I am so glad I decided to stop in. I ordered the rib and chicken dinner and loved every bit of it. One of my gripes with some BBQ places is you can't taste the smoke on the food but you could taste every bit of it on this chicken.    Both the ribs and chicken were cooked to perfection and the sauce was just right. Sweet, smoky and not over sauced. Its a small shop in the middle of the hood but you can't tell by the taste of the food. Definitely getting another plate before I go back to Tampa.

zf3i1eTjdPkebqVxnbiqQA.text: Me and my boyfriend usually goes to zbest but thought we would try something different . This has to be the nastiest tasting bbq place black owned I have tasted in so long . The Mac and cheese was one big ball with barely any taste the yams were almost whole with no type of flavor also and the sauce was nasty for my ribs and chicken and did I mention how chewy the cornbread was yuck . I give one star because y'all tried haha

LhP46q5GNpnGFbKU-X1Cuw.text: Quintessential no-frill take-out barbecue joint with delicious, smoky baby back pork ribs.  The 1/2 SLAB DINNER with 2 SMALL SIDES at $14+ came with 8 meaty ribs that were nice and tender with a super flavorful crust.  My husband and I aren't huge volume meat-eaters, so we had leftovers for days.  They forgot our sauce on the side, which initially made me super sad when we realized this at home, but they were slightly redeemed when we tasted the meat and found it didn't need sauce at all.    The MAC AND CHEESE was pretty ordinary, a bit dry even, and the GREENS were pretty salty and not my favorite.  Vegetarians beware--though the sides are advertised as pork free, my greens definitely had some chicken bits hidden throughout--a strip of skin and even a small wing bone.  Yep.    All this made for pretty shabby service, but I came to taste the ribs and I wasn't disappointed.  As a lover of divey hole-in-the-wall ethnic restaurants, I'm pretty immune to these types of frustrations.  Would for sure return for the smoky pork and the great prices.

ucfd-iyOAYsXlZsJB90cXg.text: I have to admit I was a little skeptical of this place, mostly because I don't really eat meat, but I went with my husband anyways. They are super small and in what seems to be an old storefront. The guy was outside cooking in a HUGE smoker?? I think... Anyways, I had the mac n cheese with the hot bbq sauce.... 1st please do not tell me if either of those things has meat in them and 2nd OMG YUMMMM the sauce is spicy as hell! I LOVE spicy as hell, and mixed with the mac n cheese it was creamy, cheesy, and spicy as hell. I was a vegetarian in heaven at a BBQ joint.  Also, my husband insists that the ribs were a deal and amazing, he liked them with just a little spicy sauce and mostly regular. He was not a fan of the greens (but he is never a fan of greens, I have no idea why he ordered them). We both liked the corn bread.  Great little place!

z0ZhFmflRczOCp9fZlmvGQ.text: The pork ribs were tender and juicy and had the BBQ smoky flavor.  Really enjoyed the sauce, different then most others I have had.  I think just a hint of mustard but a variety of flavors.  The Mac & Cheese is OK.  Had the Baked Beans and they are terrific, Spicy, With Peppers.  Paid $1.00 for a piece of cornbread that was moist & pretty good.   Staff was friendly and helpful when asking about the sides.   We sat outside at a table. Luckily it was one of the last warm days of the year.

-EPZ8Ncuit-X9SvEEMg3Vg.text: You won't make it through dinner clean!! Came in about 5min to closing. Brisket and turkey were gone but that was my fault. Got the half rack of pork and a side of wings. Everything was amazing, fall off the bone meat, great tangy sauce. And the greens were out of this world! As you see quite a spread and the it was only about 20 bucks great deal, great food, highly recommend.

uk3QFmnhoEeadQf7ZOXA4Q.text: Just had some of the best BBQ I've ever had in my life. Ribs were full of meat, charred just right, and the mild sauce was dynamic with multiple levels of flavor! The Broccoli and Cheese, Collard Greens (with bits of chicken?), Green Beans, and Mac & Cheese were outstanding. I got the cornbread (not a side), and it was quite tasty, kept in it's own plastic wrap.   The shop itself is humble, the seating area indoors is sparse, and there are some patio tables out front. The women behind the counter were super nice, and were happy to answer my questions. There was a nice stream of people coming in, mostly for take-out.  The hot sauce wasn't crazy-hot, but very good, added a little bite. But, if you don't have a high spice tolerance, you might stick with the mild sauce. Oh, my, this was soooo tasty! :D  After living in California for 24 years and having nothing but mostly fake BBQ, this is such a relief to have now that I've returned to Pittsburgh! I'm almost afraid to review it, because I'll have to wait in line for all you readers now. :( haha

nWziY2D9ivRnfDIafHu9-Q.text: Excellent food at extremely reasonable prices. South Carolinian here confirming everything is authentic, it's all correct. 42$ buys a feast for 5-6.

lxmfrZLLt1wE9Xev-9FmxA.text: I'm really sad to write this review so I'm going to give a benefit of the doubt and say maybe I need to give it a second chance. They opened at 12 and we got there around 12:45. They didn't have everything ready to serve and there was a wait for Mac and cheese. The employees were really nice, but it was just kinda missing.  Food: Chicken was very good but the wings were SO small. Ribs were seasoned very well with great flavors, but they weren't the most tender. Mac and cheese was a huge disappointment but I will say that ours didn't really look like the other pictures on here so maybe something happened? It wasn't very creamy/cheesy. The cabbage was really good though!   Would I go back? Yes probably later in the day or not on a weekend with hopes they would have all of their options available.

ivqXB49sWuET56sSeM4vPQ.text: Food is amazing. Ribs fall off the bone mac n cheese yams and potato salad was really good. Affordable dinners for BBQ

wURaNcD2Lqe9SWuym4xsgw.text: I've lived close by in East Liberty for 3 years, I can't believe I've never been here before!  Just a local bbq joint, nothing fancy. Amazing food, big portions, at a low price.  While some people like "fall off the bone ribs", I actually prefer my ribs to not disintegrate on impact. They are still tender, but have a great bite. The flavor it just out of this world. Perfectly seasoned and smoked. They don't skimp on the sauce either if you choose to have the sauce on the ribs.   Wings were good too!  I just wish they were opened on Monday so I could go two days in a row.

KHuWjWxIzxPR1DyubMMUxw.text: I stopped by here earlier today with my wife for lunch.  I had been wanting to head to Showcase BBQ ever since I first went by and saw all of the smokers outside.  However it has taken quite a lot time for us to get there but I am glad that we finally did!  Upon walking up to the restaurant the first thing that I noticed was their sign which says "The Burgh's #1 BBQ Spot" which is quite the proclamation but one that after dining here I am likely to agree with.  Showcase BBQ has a bit of a confusing setup where you enter through the right door, proceed to order and then exit through the other side.  If you don't follow the directions here you mess everything up.  It had some very minimal indoor seating and seating for 20 just outside the restaurant.  On this day as my wife and I often do at BBQ places we decided to split the Woodley (4 bones and 6 wings with 2 sides and 2 drinks) as well as a brisket sandwich both with the sauce already on it.  For our sides with the woodley we went with the greens and the Mac and cheese.  Once ordered, our food was ready within a few minutes and packed to go even though we were eating it outside.  The first thing that I dug into were the pork ribs.  They were delicious as they were tender to the point that they fell off the bone and had smoke flavor in each bite although with enough restraint that it wasn't overpowering the meat.  The BBQ sauce was really good to and was a Carolina based mustard sauce.  After finishing off my 2 ribs I tried the chicken wings.  While I thought that the wings looked a little small they had big flavor with the same smoke in each bite as the ribs.  After those were gone I was able to try the sides that it came with and both were delicious!  The greens were braised or cooked in some pork juices to give it some extra flavor and it also looked like there was some crushed red pepper that gave it a slight spice.  Then the Mac and cheese was super flavorful with a spice blend on it that my wife thought tasted similar to old bay while I thought it was very peppery.  Not every bite of it was as creamy as I would have liked but I still enjoyed every bite and wish I knew what was in it so that I could add it to any Mac and cheese that I make.  Last but certainly not least was the brisket sandwich which consisted of 5 think cut slabs of brisket in between two pieces of white bread.   I really wish that the bread was toasted to help keep it together a bit better but in the end it didn't really matter.  The brisket was cooked nicely and so was tender and tasty and both my wife and I enjoyed that as well.  The bottom line for me is that I will definitely head back here again in the future.  My wife and I came hungry and left stuffed and both thought the food was excellent and good value for the money.

H9F9YCUVSX6WPVa6ODcyfw.text: Best barbecue I've had in my life. Hands down. HUGE portion of ribs with two sides for just $15. The greens also tasted surprisingly good. You probably don't want to blow your calorie budget by coming here every week but when you want to treat yourself, I guarantee that this place will not disappoint you

eie0j7Qry9IbwAlHGUncUA.text: OMG!! Love their BBQ. The day we went, they opened later than usually. But, the owner was there and explained why. No one in line moved!! They were all waiting for awesome BBQ and they were not disappointed. Don't go there if you want table service, a nice ambiance, music, etc. This is all about the food. Good food. Great food in fact. The sides-let's talk rice and beans. I think the best rice and beans I have ever had!! The BBQ has a mustard base-so keep that in mind if you aren't a big mustard fan. Everyone we went with absolutely loved it there and we went with some very choosy people!!

OeynrycHWgj3DKCzT-SFJQ.text: No doubt this is the best barbecue in Pittsburgh. Potato salad blew my mind. Baked beans blew my mind.  I have some ribs caught in between my teeth from yesterday that the toothbrush won't get out and every once in a while I get a little taste of it and it's blowing my mind right now. If i could give a higher score i would.

4OXa1K4TOTTiIsZYgSuXow.text: If you've never had turkey ribs, try them! We've been here a few times but always got the beef, mostly because when I think of ribs, I think of beef or pork. We got a bunch of things for a family dinner and finally tried the turkey; oh my god. I love turkey, usually anyway it comes but I have never had it like this. It moist and full of that smoky flavor you associate with BBQ. Really delicious. The beef ribs are fantastic as well, but the turkey.... Everything we tried was good. The mac'n'cheese, the greens were really great, and the BF loved the potato salad. Chicken wings are not a favorite of mine, but they come with a kind of honey mustard sauce, which is very tasty. I was just dipping my bread in it, it was so good. The staff is usually nice as can be with a line out the door, and there is almost always a line. I would not go very early or very late; they do run out of stuff, and sometimes things aren't ready if you go when they first open. I know other people have complained about that, but to me that just what happens when you are talking about real, fresh BBQ. And a tip for your leftover turkey ribs, I was putting them on salads and put some in store bought soup lol. I love those ribs.

tP873Em0a2Lvgi93_aNiQQ.text: This is a review for a catering order. I was so pleased to learn Showcase BBQ delivers for catering! I was hosting an event right down the street and this made coordinating the delivery even easier. The order arrived on time and was set up nicely by the delivery driver.  I ordered wings, brisket and a ton of sides. The brisket was so tender and I didn't use any sauce as the flavor sans sauce was too good to change. The cornbread was far and away my favorite side of those ordered... so much butter!! I wouldn't recommend eating here on the regular, but it's a nice treat.  The price of the meal was just right and I'll definitely remember this establishment when I need future catering orders fulfilled.  My only disappointment was the lack of serving utensils. I ended up having to quickly run to a dollar general before the event, which worked out - but would have been nice to know ahead of time. All the staff I encountered in person and on the phone were pleasant and helpful.

VF4JKk93sp0bFGqyRPb9lA.text: I have been on a quest to find 5 star worthy BBQ in the Burgh, and by golly, this is it!  My friend mentioned to me a couple of weeks ago that she'd been wanting to try Showcase, since she works nearby and a coworker often gets lunch there.  As thanks for helping me drop off a window air conditioner that'd stopped functioning and pick up a new one yesterday, I decided to treat her (and myself!) to dinner from Showcase, which happened to be nearby.  I'm so glad that I seized the opportunity to try Showcase's BBQ, since we both found it positively mouthwatering!  When we went to place our order, we asked to see both the turkey and pork ribs.  The woman working asked us if we'd ever had turkey ribs before, and we said we hadn't, so she gave us a sample to try.  It was so moist and smoky, I had to order it, so we got the 6 bone dinner with them, as well as two sides of collard greens and candied yams ($16.05).  The dinner came with a generous amount of homemade sauce, which my friend applied sparingly, and I applied liberally.  While the ribs can totally stand on their own in terms of flavor, the sauce had such a complex and interesting flavor that I wanted to take advantage of it.  Please note that this sauce isn't your typical Sweet Baby Ray's or Kraft BBQ sauce--Tony D.'s review describes the flavor well, and it has just a slight kick of heat.  As for the sides, they were both great!  The greens were cooked perfectly--they were tender without being soggy or mushy--and were delicious, with just the right amount of salt.  The candied yams were sweet yet smoky in flavor, and were also tender but not overly mushy, with a somewhat chunky consistency.  Even my friend, who isn't a big fan of yams, enjoyed them!  We were originally planning to order baked beans in place of the yams, but they were out at the time of our visit.  Needless to say, given my love of mac and cheese, I would have ordered that, but my friend subsists on a GF diet, which unfortunately ruled that out.  Overall, we were very impressed with the quality of the BBQ at Showcase.  The prices are right on par with other nearby neighborhood BBQ spots, and the service was friendly.  While it's True that the neighborhood isn't the best, let's face it, sometimes the best food can be found in the unlikeliest of places--esp. when it comes to BBQ!  If you live in PGH and you enjoy BBQ, but you haven't checked out Showcase, you're missing out bigtime--so stop procrastinating and stop by ASAP for some quality 'Q!

photos.caption: Photo of Showcase BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Turkey ribs, collard greens, and candied yams

4nyRi_EhDbz5Ox0doo2n1w.text: This is one of the best bbq in the city!!   Fast, friendly service and great food!  The pork bbq ribs are so tender they fall off the bone! And that sauce is on point! You can't get ribs without that sauce! Mac n cheese side is so creamy n cheesy with a slight smoke flavor. Greens were perfectly cooked, not too mushy or salty; it's just right. Cornbread is more like corncake.   5 stars for sure!! I'd come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Showcase BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork ribs, greens, Mac n cheese, and corn cake!

rvCFfR8nDlLek4uPkurs3g.text: As I arrived there was a line out the door!!! But I waited and was happy that I did!   You will not be disappointed when it comes to this place. One tip I would share is that you should get there early to get certain sides because sometimes they run out of certain sides. However, they are always more accommodating on the sides they do have. Everything is bomb! Like literally whoever grandma be in the back cooking be sharing all the family secrets because the food is simply amazing.   So I went here a few times before and figured I check in and write about this spot because it is worthy to be praised!   I ordered a slab of ribs, four bones of turkey ribs, 10 wings, and Mac n cheese. The bbq sauce is out of this world. Just be prepared for a eat and nap situation because it's bound to happen.   I tried to order the greens this day but they didn't have any(not sure if they were made that day or just ran out) but it was an amazing time afterwards once I consumed this amazing southern cooking!   One thing that's never really mentioned ... this place doesn't have a five star restaurant look but they're food taste amazing and most importantly they're clean. While there I saw the server change gloves frequently and ensure that food was covered so that it maintained temperature.  You won't be displeased at this place, just saying I'm looking forward to next time.   One con is that they don't take on line or over the phone orders. In today's society we want to do mobile meals nah that's not happening here they're busy but it's totally worth it.

gMNtF8lKCqaMh6EJy8IGUQ.text: This food was amazing. When I'm at work we drive past this place constantly and smell the amazing food cooking out in the smoker. Had a break and decided to stop today. The people here are all so nice and try to make you feel like you're eating a good homestyle meal. The inside is definitely and order and go type of place. Not a sit down restaurant. BUT DONT LET THAT TURN YOU OFF.  Their food was, like I said, amazing. The flavor lives up to the smell I went with a coworker and we got the chicken, cheese broccoli, Mac and cheese, brisket, and corn bread. For $20 for two whole meals (with basically 1 meal left over) this place is a gem.   The brisket was full of flavor. The cornbread was the right balance of sweet and moist. The Mac and cheese was very cheesy and creamy. The cheesy broccoli reminded me of cheesy broccoli soup but it was delicious. The chicken wings were small, as to be expected, but the meat was fall of the bone.   Both of us got our sauce on the side, the bbq had a sweet and spicy taste - I thought it was a great balance.  I would recommend stopping by to pick up some food, because with these options I wasn't disappointed. In the time we sat there eating lunch, we saw about 10 people go in and out of the door with their to-go boxes and sometimes 2 boxes.

-c1Zvj72GHcp3N-5l-QjfA.text: Yeah, this place is the shit.  I have never had turkey wings before--never even heard of them, but I went half turkey half pork ribs and it was better than ice cream on a hot summer day. The turkey ribs were like if you took turkey meat and actually had moist cuts of it--smokey turkey flavor plus that moisture from it being rib meat (I had too many dry turkeys in my day). I ate them and passed out on the couch watching some pro wrestling from the 90s--dudes with neon trunks and mullets fake beating each other up while I digested those ribs.  I overate to the point of self-loathing. But it was worth it. YOLO.

sZIVfCTBTPIvy-I8siwsXg.text: This place is just out of control amazing. HANDS DOWN the best BBQ in Pittsburgh, their BBQ sauce is the most addicting sauce I've ever had. The side options are all packed with flavor, you can't make a wrong choice. It's such an unassuming location but the food is high quality comfort food and the people that work there are always so nice. I want everyone to try this place so they get all the hype they deserve BUT I don't want the secret to get out!

photos.caption: Photo of Showcase BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Half slab of ribs with mac and cheese and baked beans.

mkVVfs9kyMGr6BcMJJyH3g.text: Wow! This place is awesome! I haven't had ribs this good since I was in Alabama! This place nails it! I got a half rack meal and could hardly eat it all. The ribs were lean and meaty and smoked to perfection!!  I used to frequent a couple lace called Dreamland in Alabama, and this guy is right up there with them!   The collard greens were excellent also.   The serving size for money was really generous and the sauce is a unique mustard base that you might want in the side if you're a rookie like I was.   I was enjoying pedal pgh and it took me right past the front door, so I took a second lap and stopped for lunch!    I enjoyed the food, talking to the owner, and just taking it all in.   I have hit Yinzburgh a few times and it was good, so was Walter's in Lawrenceville, but this is much better q, and a good value too.  I'll be back soon!  Check it out!!

teT7fuDnBHXUGQmUNLzpZw.text: It's Saturday morning and I'm riding around the area on a bike thanks to Open Streets Pittsburgh. I spot a BBQ place and see the grills outside working. It's 10 AM...I will be back for you!  After I did my loop around, I head back and find the place bustling with fellow bikers. I park the Schwinn and get in line (it's out the door now). As I'm waiting the BBQ aroma gets stronger. Hmm...what to get. I stand in line reading the menu, watching and overhearing what others are thinking. As I get closer for them to take my order, I see a fresh pan of mac and cheese come out. It has a generous cheese throughout and a light brown layer on top. Yes, please! I also hear, "This is it for the pulled pork." It's not yet 12 pm and they've been busy serving hungry bikers.  I'm up. Because I want to try a bit of everything and couldn't order a kids meal as an adult (not in sound mind), I opted for 2 pork ribs, 3 wings, and two side dinner: mac and cheese and greens. "We're out of greens. How about green beans or broccoli and cheese?" Green beans, please. $10--of goodness.  Seats outside were taken by other hungry folks, so I sat at a high top inside neat the open garage door. On this day I people watched as much as the people in line watched me eat. The plate is so big! Portions mare HUGE! The ribs were so big and tasty. Definitely slow cooked bbq, you could taste the smoke. I ate both, but it was an effort to do so. Sadly, I couldn't eat more protein and saved the wings for later. There is still the sides to eat. The mac and cheese was glorious as expected from seeing the new pan come out. The green beans were excellent! I generally am not a fan, but the flavors and hint of spice made it a wonderful side.  I'd definitely be back!  Here are some tips: - This is a to the point kind of place. Ingredients cost money, they'll let you know by the signs on the wall. Personally, I appreciate this. - Ribs are turkey or pork. State your preference when ordering. - Sides don't have pork in them. - Cornbread is available and is extra. - Don't be on the phone and ordering. It's just rude and they have signs to ask you not to do so.

photos.caption: Photo of Showcase BBQ - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 2 ribs, 3 wing, and 2 sides for $10

4Eci66d6OlzM9HM7soIyXg.text: tl;dr The ribs themselves are very good. The red beans and rice are ok. The sauce, chicken, and collards are not good.  The meat on the ribs has a really nice smoky flavor that's enhanced by the rubs. I shouldn't have had them pour the sauce over, which is their usual practice, though; even though it seemed to have a nice amount of vinegar/mustard at first, it's quite sweet and becomes unpleasantly so over time, to the point that I was dreading the sauce while looking forward to the meat. Chicken is weirdly dry and chewy.  I might go again and strictly order dry ribs with sauce on the side, but I don't feel a profound need to.

nkQV-xpEKgDcyU31LKFTDA.text: Three of us shared a half order of pork ribs and a half order of turkey ribs (which were super special). It was the perfect portion. The sauce is like a sweet , and spice honey mustard brown sauce, not the usual tomato based bbq sauce. The meat was tender, Smokey, and not fatty at all. The place has a nice community feel to it. It's mostly a take out spot but with pleasant umbrella covered tables on front. Definitely a local treat.

L9uhJ8ShCB9S_2LXkzJNQA.text: I work so close to this location but never knew that it even existed until some coworkers wanted to go there.   I'm a big fan of pulled pork so I went with that and was I happy with that decision!  For $7 I got a sandwich that was enough for two people.   At first glance their sauce is odd to look at since it's not your traditional red bbq sauce that you would expect to see. It's a brown sauce!  I got it on the side since I wasn't sure how it would tase. Next time I'll be sure to have them put it on it because it tasted so good!

Zb-T7lVE44r4MWiT78WbEg.text: Ambiance: Definitely hole-in-a-wall that's a little dark and bare inside. They have tables outside but they're that wire-mesh style so be careful with that BBQ sauce. Food is served cafeteria style, you order and they immediately assemble everything for you. The staff was a little brusk trying to move the line along but they were not mean in any way.   Food: We had the pork ribs which had a nice smokey-charred flavor and pulled off the bone easily. The rib silverskin was crispy which I enjoyed and the spice rub was complex enough to not need any sauce. A half-rack was also more than enough for one person. The chopped brisket sandwich was pretty good but ultimately nothing special, neither dry nor super moist, smokey but not particularly beefy. The BBQ sauce had a great balance between tangy, sweet, and a hint of mustard-spiciness but by the end of the meal I found myself wishing they had more options to mix things up. The mac was cheesy and not an congealed mass like most cafeteria-style restaurants. The beans were surprisingly good as well, they were sweet but not sickeningly so. Not the   Having moved from Kansas City, I've been looking for good no-frills BBQ and this place definitely fits the bill. It's not fancy and there's not a lot of sauce options but what they do, they do well. Definitely give this place a try.
